adrFormatAddress: 2046 Adam Clayton Powell Jr Blvd, New York, NY 10027, USA

originalText.text:
So I got the chicken sliders and fries and they were really really really good. I ended up getting also the catfish and mashed potatoes with corn. Really good.

This place is like a diamond in a rough man. It's a hidden place. Doesn't look that appealing when you look inside the decor but who cares? Those are always the good spots.

The only thing with the sliders I think me personally when I make sliders in my house you can always put like some kind of some kind of sauce on the bread because I don't want the bread to be totally dry but they were really good.

Sorry man unfortunately only have one picture because I forgot to take the picture of the catfish because I ate it so fast. I was just so hungry but I'm going to go back there today and we will see if they are consistent

Fingers crossed because every time I go to these places and I review them then their food falls right off then. So I'm going to go back today and I hope their food is really good I want yesterday and yesterday was February 7th 2024. Today is the 8th and so I'm going today for lunch.

Here is the second pic for you all. Food is absolutely great.

originalText.text: Tenders are for real. Probably the closest I've had to how I make them at home, but done much better. Nice and light and big, almost like a chicken katsu, which is welcome with all the damn fries. Portions are big. Good deal, good food, new spot on my shortlist. Nice dude, too. And they charge the right amount for a can of soda.

originalText.text: We were surprised to learn that Brooklyn's only French Fry restaurant, Spudz, has a second location in Harlem on Adam Clayton Powell Jr Blvd. They serve some amazing food, including their KINGSTON AVE FRIES With JERK CHICKEN. The dish is a combination of bold, spicy and sweet flavors, with juicy and tender jerk chicken coated in a smoky and savory jerk BBQ sauce. The mango pieces add a touch of tropical sweetness and balance out the heat from the spices, while the fried plantains provide a caramelized sweetness. The peppers bring in a zesty kick. We also tried their delicious CATFISH SLIDERS served with MOTSAUCE. Although we had never heard of Motsauce, it turned out to be a tangy and slightly spicy sauce that paired perfectly with the crispy, golden-brown fried catfish. Be sure to try their mash box, we had the CHICKEN & SHRIMP MASH, which was a combination of crunchy chicken and juicy shrimp with creamy, smooth and buttery mashed potatoes. The sauce ties everything together, adding a rich and flavorful drizzle. Overall, it was truly a feast!

The sauce ties everything together, adding a rich and flavorful drizzle. Overall, it was truly a feast!

originalText.text: I found out about this place on instagram and I finally tried them out yesterday. I had the catfish slider combo, which is two small sliders & waffle cut fries,with the Remulade sauce. My boyfriend chose the option to build his own loaded fries. He chose the regular cut fries with jerk chicken, peppers, onions, pickles and sweet plantains topped with this caramelized sauce ðŸ˜‹. Everything was sooo good, No exaggeration. Combined he paid $30, not expensive at all.
